{{< entity_summary >}}
The Government of Canada spent an estimated **\$6.4M in 2021-2022** on contracts with CANADIAN BUREAU FOR INTERNATIONAL EDUCATION.

Across 7 contracts active since the start of the 2017-2018 fiscal year, 1 have at least one amendment (14%). Of contracts with amendments, the average increase in dollar value was 22% and the average number of amendments was 1. Cumulatively these amendments represent an increase of \$8.9M over the original contract values.

The average contract duration was 1.96 years, and the average contract value (not including contracts under \$10k) was \$9.1M. The longest contract was 6.95 years. The largest contract by value (including amendments) was \$49.9M.

{{< /entity_summary >}}
